commentMessage: I think it would be really valuable to wrap up with comparative time-space analyses of the recursive and iterative solutions, to help people understand why -- if recursive algorithms are so much more elegant -- they'll very rarely (if ever) see them in a professional development context.
Shouldn't the termination relation for the first code snippet be n<1 and not n<=1 ?
"Whenever you see a function call for the second time you are going to pop it. "
